text: The 2012 Porsche Carrera Cup Italia season was the sixth Porsche Carrera Cup Italy season. It began on 5 May in Vallelunga and finished on 21 October in Monza. Vito Postiglione won the championship driving for Ebimotors, which won the teams' championship. ==Teams and drivers== {|class="wikitable" style="font-size: 85%;" !Team ! !Drivers !Class !Rounds |- |rowspan=4| Ebimotors | 4 | Vito Postiglione | | All |- | 55 | Giacomo Scanzi |align=center| M | All |- | 63 | Fabrizio Bignotti |align=center| M | All |- | 77 | Luigi Lucchini |align=center| M | All |- |rowspan=7| Petricorse Motorsport |rowspan=3| 7 | Luigi Ferrara | | 1-3 |- | Norbert Siedler | | 6 |- | Massimiliano Busnelli | | 7 |- | 16 | Edoardo Piscopo |align=center| S | 1-5 |- | 30 | Camilo Zurcher | | 1-2 |- | 70 | Ferdinando Geri |align=center| M | 5 |- | 78 | Marco Cassarà |align=center| M | 3-7 |- |rowspan=4| Erre Esse Motorsport | 11 | Alessandro Cicognani | | 5 |- | 52 | Angelo Proietti |align=center| M | All |- |rowspan=2| 76 | Pierluigi Alessandri |align=center| M | 1-2 |- | Omar Galbiati |align=center| M | 3-4, 6-7 |- | Tsunami Racing Team | 13 | Oleksandr Gaidai | | All |- |rowspan=5| Antonelli Motorsport | 14 | Stefano Comini | | 7 |- | 15 | Gianluca Giraudi | | All |- | 27 | Matteo Malucelli | | 1-5 |- | 72 | Alberto Brambati |align=center| M | 6-7 |- | 84 | Alberto de Amicis |align=center| M | All |- | Cram Motorsport | 16 | Edoardo Piscopo |align=center| S | 6-7 |- |rowspan=4| Heaven Motorsport | 17 | Enrico Fulgenzi |align=center| S | All |- | 18 | Stefano Costantini | | All |- | 19 | Walter Ben | | All |- | 59 | Alberto Petrini |align=center| M | 1-6 |- |rowspan=3| Mik Corse | 23 | Daniel Mancinelli |align=center| S | All |- | 60 | Giorgio Piccioni |align=center| M | 1, 3, 7 |- | 67 | Alex de Giacomi |align=center| M | All |- | Pole Team | 69 | Günther Blieninger |align=center| M | 1-5, 7 |} {| class="wikitable" style="font-size: 85%;" |- !
